data_maturity_score.evidence: The role uses multiple ETL tools and multi‑cloud platforms but lacks mention of modern orchestration, CI/CD, or data‑quality frameworks, indicating a developing data practice.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score 2 maps to the "developing" maturity level.

maturity_signals.evidence: Job requires experience with AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, showing a cloud‑native (multi‑cloud) orientation.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Responsibilities are limited to BI reporting, ETL, and Cognos administration; no mention of dev‑ops, ML, or product engineering duties.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Consulting environments often have project‑driven peaks, but the posting does not explicitly call out long hours or on‑call duties.

role_clarity.evidence: Pass 2 classifies scope_definition as "clear" and the job description lists concrete BI and ETL tasks.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low scope creep, moderate overtime risk, clear responsibilities, and high requirement strictness combine to a modest overall risk.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: The posting does not specify a manager or reporting line.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No titles (e.g., Head of Data, Director) are referenced in the description.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about hiring trends or team expansion is provided.

team_composition.evidence: The job posting does not disclose team size, DE headcount, or seniority mix.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: The role is described as part of a consulting delivery center, not as an embedded product‑team position.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No PTO, flexible‑hours, or on‑call policies are mentioned; consulting roles often have variable hours.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: The posting lacks any mention of mentorship, learning budgets, or clear promotion paths.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Only traditional BI tools (Cognos, DataStage) are listed; no reference to modern engineering practices such as code review, CI/CD, or monitoring.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No explicit signals of open‑source contribution, conference support, or innovation programs are present.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: The description does not reference code review, CI/CD pipelines, testing, or monitoring practices.

innovation_signals.evidence: No language about experimentation, R&D time, or adoption of new technologies beyond listed clouds and ETL tools.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: There is no mention of refactoring, tech‑debt reduction, or modernization initiatives.

ai_integration_level.evidence: The posting contains no reference to machine‑learning, AI, or related tooling.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools are listed among the required or nice‑to‑have skills.

hiring_urgency.evidence: No start‑date or urgency language appears in the description.

competition_level.evidence: No data on applicant volume, location desirability, or salary competitiveness is provided.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a globally established, publicly traded technology enterprise.

hiring_velocity.evidence: The posting does not discuss hiring pace or multiple open roles.

team_size_signals.evidence: No indication of the size of the data engineering or broader team is given.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a mature public company; funding stage terminology is not applicable.

role_creation_type.evidence: The description does not state whether this is a new headcount, backfill, or expansion role.

strength_details: The role has a precise focus on BI reporting and ETL using Cognos and industry‑standard data integration tools.
Candidates must have hands‑on experience with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Position is within IBM Consulting, a large and stable enterprise with global reach.
Requirements are explicitly listed (minimum 3 years experience, specific tools), reducing ambiguity.
concern_details: Compensation range, bonuses, or equity are not provided in the posting.
There is no mention of visa sponsorship; the role is limited to candidates already authorized to work in India.
Consulting projects can require periods of extended work hours, though no on‑call duties are specified.
best_fit_details: Engineers with 3‑5 years of experience in ETL, BI reporting, and Cognos administration.
Professionals comfortable working across multiple cloud environments and traditional data‑warehouse tools.
Candidates seeking a stable, enterprise‑level data engineering position rather than a startup environment.
probe_details: Ask for the full compensation package, including base salary, bonus, and any equity components.
Clarify expected weekly work hours, on‑call responsibilities, and how overtime is handled.
Inquire about formal promotion tracks, mentorship programs, and opportunities for skill development.
Find out the size, skill mix, and seniority distribution of the data engineering team you’ll join.
Understand who you will report to (e.g., manager, lead, director) and the broader reporting hierarchy.
leverage_details: Your 3+ years of Cognos and multi‑cloud ETL experience aligns directly with the core requirements.
Experience with IBM InfoSphere DataStage is a niche skill that IBM values highly.
If you can start promptly, you meet any implicit urgency the consulting team may have.
summary.overall_assessment: The role offers a clear, well‑defined data‑engineering focus within a large, stable enterprise and requires concrete BI and ETL expertise. Compensation details are opaque and there is no visa support, while consulting project cycles may lead to occasional overtime. Overall, it is a solid fit for mid‑level engineers seeking enterprise experience.
